psidev.psi.mi.filemakers.xmlFlattener.structure
Class XsdTreeStructImpl

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      psidev.psi.mi.filemakers.xsd.AbstractXsdTreeStruct
          psidev.psi.mi.filemakers.xmlFlattener.structure.XsdTreeStructImpl

public class XsdTreeStructImpl
extends AbstractXsdTreeStruct

This class overides the abstract class AbstractXslTreeStruct to provide a tree representation of a XML schema, with management of transformation of an XML file to a flat file.

Author:
Arnaud Ceol, University of Rome "Tor Vergata", Mint group, arnaud@cbm.bio.uniroma2.it

elementFilters

public java.util.HashMap elementFilters
this map contains regular expression used to filter XML node if a node do not validate the regexp, itself or its parent element (in case of attribute) will be ignored

maxCounts

public java.util.HashMap maxCounts
this HashMap keep the maximum amount of a node type found in the file for a type of node. The key is the String association of the name of the parent and the name of the node

firstElement

public boolean firstElement
true if currently printed element is the first of a ligne. Used to know if a separator is needed when prining the flat file.

selections

public java.util.ArrayList selections

getInfos

public java.lang.String getInfos(XsdNode node)
Description copied from class: AbstractXsdTreeStruct
describes the node with informations such as its name or its XML type. Other informations should probably have to be added when extending this class

write

public void write(java.io.Writer out)
           throws java.io.IOException
create a flat file separated by specified separator containing every element contained in the XML document and selected on the tree, with a first line that contains the tiltles of columns

Parameters:

Throws:
java.io.IOException

getMaxCount

public int getMaxCount(XsdNode node)
get the maximum amount of element of a type as child of another type of element in the XML document. It is used to know how many columns have to be created in the flat file, as even empty ones have to be printed.

getMaxCount

public int getMaxCount(org.w3c.dom.Node element,
                       XsdNode parent,
                       XsdNode target,
                       java.util.Enumeration path)
get the maximum amount of element of a type as child of another type of element in the XML document. It is used to know how many columns have to be created in the flat file, as even empty ones have to be printed.

Parameters:
element - the element in the XML document
parent - the parent of the node on the tree
target - the node on the tree
path - the path to access to the node
